docs.lead_paragraph: The Bill, Hillary & Chelsea Clinton Foundation and an associated charity refiled tax returns for six years with the U.S. Internal Revenue Service to amend their reporting of donations from foreign governments and other errors, the charities said on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Twenty-five governors pledged to block the refugees from entering their states, because the terrorists who attacked Paris last week included a man who had entered Europe with a Syrian passport.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Matt Flegenheimer, Trip Gabriel, Julia Preston, Katharine Q. Seelye and Jeremy W. Peters.
byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and JULIE BOSMAN

docs.snippet: Twenty-five governors pledged to block the refugees from entering their states, because the terrorists who attacked Paris last week included a man who had entered Europe with a Syrian passport....
docs.abstract: Twenty-five Republican governors say they will block entry of Syrian refugees into their states, arguing safety of Americans is at stake in wake of Paris terrorist attacks; other members of Congress and presidential candidates also defy Pres Obama's plan to resettle 10,000 Syrians.

headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Governors Vow to Close Doors to Syrian Refugees
headline.main: G.O.P. Governors Vow to Close Doors to Syrian Refugees

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton defended her long-running ties to the nation's finance industry on Monday, bringing out allies to argue that she would take a tough approach to regulating the industry despite receiving tens of millions in both personal and campaign cash from Wall Street in her career.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie’s focus on terrorism and crime has helped him turn the page on the political retribution scandal that has threatened his bid for the Republican nomination.
docs.snippet: Gov. Chris Christie’s focus on terrorism and crime has helped him turn the page on the political retribution scandal that has threatened his bid for the Republican nomination....
docs.abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie has adopted political stance focused on maintaining law in order in appeal to voters worried about terrorism and crime and in attempt to set himself apart in Republican field; position is also aimed at helping Christie move past 2013 George Washington Bridge scandal.

headline.print_headline: Law-and-Order Stance Lets Christie Sidestep Bridge Scandal in ’16 Race
headline.main: Chris Christie, Taking Law-and-Order Stance, Sidesteps Bridge Scandal in ’16 Race
